bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: List of references in the Howard-Tilton Memorial Library dealing with the human side of yellow fever epidemics in New Orleans, by [Miss Renshaw], December 16, 1941

div1.p: A list of references sent to Hench by Robert Usher notes articles that document the human side of New Orleans yellow fever epidemics.

div1.head: List of references in the Howard-Tilton Memorial Library dealing with the human side of yellow fever epidemics in New Orleans, by [Miss Renshaw], December 16, 1941

list.head:
List of references in the Howard-Tilton Memorial Library
dealing with the human side of yellow fever
epidemics in New Orleans.
December 16, 1941
list.item:
Augustin, George - History of yellow fever. N.O., Searcy &
Pfaff, 1909. Bibliographies.

Barren, P. D. - An historic memorabile relating to the yellow
fever epidemic of 1799. Translated by J. J.
Castellanos. (In New Orleans medical and surgical
journal, v. 49, Dec. 1896, p. 318-322

Cable, George W. - The Creoles of Louisiana. N.Y., Charles
Scribner's sons, 1899. p. 291-302.

Clapp, Theodore - Autobiographical sketches and recollections
during a thirty-five years residence in New
Orleans. Boston, Phillips, Sampson, 1857.
Ch. 8, p. 185-221; Ch. 10, p. 255-264)

Davidson, J. P. - Some personal reminiscences of early epidemics
in New Orleans. (In New Orleans medical and
surgical journal. v. 14, June 1887, p. 920-932)

Dowler, Bennet - Tableau of the yellow fever of 1853 with the
epidemics of New Orleans. (In Cohen's New
Orleans Directory of 1854, p. 7-66)

Hamilton, Thomas - Men and manners in America. Edinburgh, Cadell,
1833. v. 2, p. 212-214.

History and incidents of the plague in New Orleans. (In Harper's
magazine, v. 7, Nov. 1853, p. 797-806)

Heustis, Jabez - Physical observations and medical tracts and
researches on the topography and diseases of
Louisiana. N.Y., Swords, 1817. p. 109-119.

Jones, A. P. - Yellow fever in a rural district. (In New Orleans
medical and hospital gazette. v. 1, no. 8, June 15,
1854. p. 180-89; v. 1, no. 9, July 1, 1854, p. 205-09)

McMain, Eleanor - Behind the yellow fever in Little Palermo (New
Orleans) (In Charities, v. 15, Nov. 4, 1905,
p. 152-9)

Nolte, Vincent - Fifty-years in both hemispheres. N.Y., Redfield,
1854. p. 91.

Orleans central relief committee - Report of the Orleans central
relief committee to all those who have so
generously contributed to the yellow fever
sufferers of New Orleans from the great epidemic
of 1878. New Orleans, Clark, 1879.

[Robinson, William L.] - The diary of a samaritan. By a member
of the Howard Association of New Orleans.
N.Y., Harper, 1860.

Young Men's Christian Assn., New Orleans - Report of the relief
work ... in the yellow fever epidemic
of 1878. N.O., Nelson, 1879.
